title: Private room in Envie Student for sublet
description:
The apartment is called Envie Student. It is located at Little Italy. Looking for a male student under 25 years old to take over my sublet from May 3rd (2020) to August (2020). It is very suitable for students, especially taking either the school summer programs or other activities during spring/summer time.

The apartment is not allowed to raise pets. The room is furnished including a double bed, a long desk, an open closet, a tiny drawer and one private bathroom. The room has a fantastic view of Dow’s Lake. The kitchen, living room and in-suite washing machine and dryer are shared with three other roommates who are friendly.

There is a penthouse on top of the apartment where a good place to make friends. A coffee shop is on the ground floor where coffee and food are available. On the second floor where study rooms and gym are can meet the needs to study in groups or in person and exercise. There is also a free shuttle bus every Sunday to supermarket.

Unfortunately, the O-train (line 2) nearby will be closed for expansion of its line on May 2nd, 2020, but there will be temporary bus service when the O-train is under construction. There will be buses to Carleton University.

There will also have buses to Bayview station where you can take LRT (O-train line 1) to Parliament, Downtown and University of Ottawa, etc.

Both Carleton University and Bayview station (LRT O-train line 1) are about 1.5 km away from the apartment. Either walk or bus is a good option because the weather is pretty good from May to August. Once you get on the LRT at Bayview station, it’s about 15 minutes’ train to Downtown, University of Ottawa.

The unit is $990 per month including Wi-Fi, water, electricity and heating fee.

title: University, College & Young Professional Accommodation In Ottawa
description:
For students living in the National Capital Region, Saint Paul University Residence is the place to be. No other accommodations in the area offer the opportunity to meet and interact with students from three different institutions of higher learning. Here you will find students from Saint Paul University, the University of Ottawa as well as Carleton University. Want to live close to downtown as well as your classes? Then, Saint Paul University Residence is the place for you.


Suite Features


-Oversized double bed (54" by 80")

-Kitchenette with sink, microwave and refrigerator

-Private three-piece bathroom within each suite

-Large desk and work area

-High-speed Internet access (following Saint Paul University usage policies)

-Private phone line with voice mail and local access

-Television with cable in each room

-Air-conditioned suites

-Light housekeeping service

-Barrier-free suite available for students with physical limitations


Security


-Controlled-access building

-Front desk staffed 24 hours a day

-On-site management

-All common rooms and hallways are video recorded

-Sign-in policy enforced for all guests


Advantages


-The Residence is a secure building with controlled-access entry and video-recorded common areas

-Accommodations come fully furnished

-Laundry, kitchen & BBQ facilities

-Regular social and educational activities organized by the Residence Life Staff

-Environmentally friendly smoke-free facility

-24-hour customer service counter

-Proximity to class means more study time and less travel time

-Pay only for your academic year and avoid a 12-month lease

-Eliminate hassles with deposits for utilities and phone or with roommates who do not pay their share

-With so many other residents in one location, it is easy to get together to form study groups and complete team assignments

-Study in your room or in any of the many Residence common lounges, or use the University resources located just steps away

description:
At Accountapotamus Inc., we've successfully taught thousands of students all things Accounting, Bookkeeping and Quickbooks; teaching our programs in our hometown of Ottawa on a monthly basis, but also in cities and towns all across Ontario. According to Intuit, we are the largest Quickbooks Desktop trainer in the province.


We know how frustrating and time-consuming it can be trying to find a professional, clean and reliable space for meetings or courses that fits your budget and meets your needs. We get it. That’s why we built our own.


In our new Kanata office, we have a gorgeous meeting room full of natural light and a boardroom-style table that comfortably fits 10 people with additional seating available. There is a small break-out area with a large granite surface, perfect for lunch breaks, and we are more than happy to provide coffee, tea and water at no extra cost. We also include the use of our projector and whiteboards for your convenience.


COST:			

$175+HST/day or $100/half day + HST


SIZE:	

Comfortably seats 10 boardroom-style, with additional seating available and a small break-out area (total 324 sqft)


AVAILABILITY:		

8:00 am - 4:00 pm/Monday-Friday

Flexible: evenings & weekends available upon request


INCLUDED/FREE:	

Coffee/tea/water

Use of projector & whiteboards

Wifi

Parking


LOCATION: 		

Accountapotamus Inc.

235 Terence Matthews Cres., Suite 100

Kanata ON K2M 2B3


OTHER: 	

Laptops are available to rent onsite, for $50 each/day (plus HST).

Bookings will be confirmed upon receipt of payment. In the case of cancellations, a full refund will be made where either one week of notice is provided or in the event that we are able to re-book the space.

title: University, College & Young Professional Accommodation In Ottawa
description:
For students living in the National Capital Region, Saint Paul University Residence is the place to be. No other accommodations in the area offer the opportunity to meet and interact with students from three different institutions of higher learning. Here you will find students from Saint Paul University, the University of Ottawa as well as Carleton University. Want to live close to downtown as well as your classes? Then, Saint Paul University Residence is the place for you.


Suite Features


-Oversized double bed (54" by 80")

-Kitchenette with sink, microwave and refrigerator

-Private three-piece bathroom within each suite

-Large desk and work area

-High-speed Internet access (following Saint Paul University usage policies)

-Private phone line with voice mail and local access

-Television with cable in each room

-Air-conditioned suites

-Light housekeeping service

-Barrier-free suite available for students with physical limitations


Security


-Controlled-access building

-Front desk staffed 24 hours a day

-On-site management

-All common rooms and hallways are video recorded

-Sign-in policy enforced for all guests


Advantages


-The Residence is a secure building with controlled-access entry and video-recorded common areas

-Accommodations come fully furnished

-Laundry, kitchen & BBQ facilities

-Regular social and educational activities organized by the Residence Life Staff

-Environmentally friendly smoke-free facility

-24-hour customer service counter

-Proximity to class means more study time and less travel time

-Pay only for your academic year and avoid a 12-month lease

-Eliminate hassles with deposits for utilities and phone or with roommates who do not pay their share

-With so many other residents in one location, it is easy to get together to form study groups and complete team assignments

-Study in your room or in any of the many Residence common lounges, or use the University resources located just steps away

At Accountapotamus Inc., we've successfully taught thousands of students all things Accounting, Bookkeeping and Quickbooks; teaching our programs in our hometown of Ottawa on a monthly basis, but also in cities and towns all across Ontario. According to Intuit, we are the largest Quickbooks Desktop trainer in the province.


We know how frustrating and time-consuming it can be trying to find a professional, clean and reliable space for meetings or courses that fits your budget and meets your needs. We get it. That’s why we built our own.

title: Room for rent (Female international student only)
description:
I have room for rent for an international female student in a townhouse condo with two bathrooms. Females only!!! That being said, I had to kick out a male student who did $3000.00 of damage to one of the rooms.


The room has been renovated and fully furnished with brand new carpet, Ikea bed, desk, lamp… There’s a washer and dryer in the house, two fridges so ample space to store your food.


This is a great area to live in. Bus stop is just a hot minute walk (86, 89, 111). Carleton U and Algonquin is 15-20 minutes. Ottawa U and downtown is roughly 20--30 minutes, depending on traffic.


The area is full of outdoor shopping malls (bestbuy, winners, wallmart, loblaws metro, farmboy, canadian tire, shoppers drug mart, dollarama, pubs, lots of pho, noodle, thai - too many to list, and Merivale mall. All this within 3-5 min by bus or can walk it in 20 minutes.. There is a mini strip mall across the street with a convenience store pub, pizza, Chinese restaurant etc.


What I am looking for is someone who cleans up after themselves i.e. if you can cook, you can definitely clean up after yourself. Not asking for much, just asking that you clean up after your mess. As well, keep the room tidy and clean, and bathroom after use. Just be respectful of the house and to everyone.


However, if you like to have friends over, or you’re in party mode, this is not the place for you. It's peaceful and quiet here, and thus far we want to keep that vibe going.

FYI... this is not an all girls house. I live here myself (male) in the basement and two extremely friendly adopted cats.


Room is $580 (all incl)

Available April 1st

First and last required

For students living in the National Capital Region, Saint Paul University Residence is the place to be.
